result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander J Avitia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander J Avitia

records.addlTxt:
Petitioner appears. Michael Radavich appears for the City of Milwaukee. 
Case in court for return of property hearing. Petitioner appears without counsel. Petitioner did provide proof of ownership. State conducted a E-Trace and found Petitioner is the lawful owner of the firearm.  
City does not object to return of property for reasons placed on the record. Court Granted Petitioner's request for return of property.
Return of property hearing on September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Alexander J Avitia in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Milwaukee County Ordinance 63.01.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest. Court found the Defendant guilty. Court orders Defendant to pay a forfeiture of $100.00 including costs to be paid by 10-16-2022 or civil judgment for failure to pay.

Defendant Alexander J Avitia in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alexander J Avitia appeared by video means. Defendant has not obtained counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37. All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription,or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 05/18/2022. 
IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Alexander J Avitia in court.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/16/2022@2:30pm
